headline: RIAs Show Low Exposure to the Latest Crypto Crash

headline: Billionaire Larry Fink: 'No One Should Have to Work Longer Than They Want To' — But Retiring At 65 Is 'Crazy'
summary: Retirement at 65 isn't some eternal truth. It's a relic from a time when most people didn't live long enough to enjoy it. In his 2024 annual letter to BlackRock investors, billionaire CEO Larry Fink questioned why Americans still treat 65 as the default finish line. "No one should have to work longer than they want to," he wrote. "But I do think it's a bit crazy that our anchor idea for the right retirement age — 65 years old — originates from the time of the Ottoman Empire." The 65-Year Benchma

headline: BlackRock Announces Completion of Certain Municipal CEF Reorganizations and Adoption of Discount Management Program
summary: NEW YORK, February 09, 2026--BlackRock Advisors, LLC announced today each of the closed-end funds named below (each, a "Fund" and collectively, the "Funds") have completed their reorganizations or mergers, as applicable (each, a "Reorganization" and collectively, the "Reorganizations"). headline: Major shareholder announcement
summary: In accordance with section 30 of the Capital Markets Act, Pandora A/S hereby announces that BlackRock, Inc. has notified the company that it now holds 6,729,003 shares, corresponding to 8.51% of the total voting rights and share capital (unchanged). Additionally, BlackRock, Inc. controls voting rights attached to financial instruments amounting to 1.55% (previously 1.45%). In total, BlackRock, Inc. control 10.07% of the company’s voting rights (previously 9.97%).ABOUT PANDORAPandora is the world

headline: Why making Bitcoin quantum-proof now could do more harm than good
summary: Efforts to make Bitcoin quantum-proof warrant extreme caution. We cannot know whether quantum resistant cryptography works yet, says CoinShares analyst. Quantum attacks could take a decade to materialise.

raw.headline: Why making Bitcoin quantum-proof now could do more harm than good
raw.summary: Efforts to make Bitcoin quantum-proof warrant extreme caution. We cannot know whether quantum resistant cryptography works yet, says CoinShares analyst. Quantum attacks could take a decade to materialise.

headline: Here's why the quantum threat for bitcoin may be smaller than people fear
summary: The key point is that most of the potentially exposed bitcoin isn’t sitting in a handful of giant, juicy targets. It’s scattered across more than 32,000 separate wallets.

raw.headline: Here's why the quantum threat for bitcoin may be smaller than people fear
raw.summary: The key point is that most of the potentially exposed bitcoin isn’t sitting in a handful of giant, juicy targets. It’s scattered across more than 32,000 separate wallets.
